alert.note: Alert for Butte; Glenn (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 8:33AM PDT until March 16 at 8:20PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River At Ord Ferry affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River At Vina Woodson Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Tehama Bridge affecting Tehama County. .High water levels are expected to continue on the Upper Sacramento River system. The Sacramento River at Ord Ferry is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sacramento River at Ord Ferry. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 110.3 feet, Head cuts in 3Bs silt weir start overflow into Butte Basin, flooding dips on Ord Ferry Road west of River Road. Persistent flows at or above this level increase flooding in Butte Basin. Ord Ferry Road and additional roads in Glenn and Colusa counties are closed due to flooding. At 113.8 feet, Design overflow level for M&T, 3Bs and Goose Lake flood control facilities to divert flood flows into Butte Basin. M&T overflows close River Road from Ord Ferry Road to Chico Road. Ord Ferry Road is already closed. At 114.0 feet, Designated flood stage left bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 114.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM PDT Thursday was 114.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 114.9 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 114.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 114.8 feet on 03/21/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued this morning at 945 AM PDT.
